sen.j: 鷲尾 隆量（わしのお たかかず、慶長11年（1606年） - 寛文2年8月23日 (旧暦)（1662年10月5日））は、江戸時代前期の公家。
sen.e: Takakazu WASHINOO (1606 – October 5, 1662) was a court noble of the early Edo period.
Takakazu WASHINOO (1606 – October 5, 1662) was a court noble of the early Edo period.
Takakazu WASHINOO (1606 – October 5, 1662) was a court noble of the early Edo period.
He was adopted into the Washinoo family and his father-in-law was Takanao WASHINOO.
He was an adopted son of Takanao WASHINOO.
He was an adopted son of Takanao WASHINOO.
His natural father was Kanekatsu HIROHASHI.
His natural father was Kanekatsu HIROHASHI.
His natural father was Kanekatsu HIROHASHI.
The kakaku (family status) is the Urin family.
The kakaku (family status) is the Urin family.
The kakaku (family status) is the Urin family.

sen.j: 官位は正二位権大納言。
sen.e: He served as Shonii Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor at senior second rank).
He served as Shonii Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor at senior second rank).
sen.cmt: 大納言＝chief councilor としました。
sen.e: He served as Shonii Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state at senior second rank).
His lawful wife was a daughter Takanao WASHINOO.
His lawful wife was a daughter Takanao WASHINOO.
His lawful wife was a daughter Takanao WASHINOO.

sen.j: 子女は鷲尾隆光、鷲尾隆尹、娘（相良頼喬継室）、天長院（吉川広嘉室）、娘（橋本実松継室）、高倉局（東福門院付き中臈）。
sen.e: Among his children, Takamitsu WASHINOO, Takatada WASHINOO, a daughter who became the second wife of Yoritaka SAGARA, Tenchoin (the wife of Hiroyoshi KIKKAWA), a daughter who became the wife of Sanematsu HASHIMOTO, Takakura no tsubone who served Tofukumonin as Churo (female housekeeper of middle rank), are known.
